headline: Why Salesforce (CRM) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of CRM software giant Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) fell 7.2% in the afternoon session after negative sentiment spread across the software sector as peers including Microsoft (MSFT), SAP (SAP), and ServiceNow (NOW) provided mixed updates.

headline: Jim Cramer on Figma: “I Don’t Want to Touch Design Software”
summary: Figma, Inc. (NYSE:FIG) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer was recently asked about. Noting that the stock is down more than 20%, a caller asked about the stock. In response, Cramer said: Yeah, yeah. They bagged people on that one, man. People actually, no, I shouldn’t say that. People got too excited about it. […]

headline: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

headline: ServiceNow Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Software Stock Is Tumbling.
summary: ServiceNow  can’t catch a break.  The software company’s earnings report beat expectations but investors are shunning the sector and still look wary of its acquisition strategy, sending shares lower early Thursday.  ServiceNow delivered better-than-expected quarterly results and an upbeat outlook in its earnings after the market close on Wednesday.

headline: Software stocks fall premarket as Microsoft and SAP results weigh

headline: Adobe Acquired Semrush Holdings (SEMR) at a 78% premium
summary: Pernas Research LLC, which manages assets in the “Pernas Portfolio,” released its fourth-quarter 2025 investor letter. A copy of the letter can be downloaded here. The Portfolio returned 4.8% in Q4 compared to the S&P 500’s 2.7% return. Furthermore, the Portfolio significantly outperformed the S&P 500 in 2025, returning 54.3%. 2025 was a volatile year […]

headline: This Week In E-Commerce - Swiss B2C Market Grows Steadily Spurs Business Opportunities
summary: The Swiss B2C ecommerce market presents notable growth prospects across sectors like retail, travel, and technology, driven by diverse payment methods and favorable consumer demographics. According to a recent report by Research and Markets, the market is expected to grow by 6.3% annually, reaching US$23.62 billion by 2025, with an upward trend projected to continue, culminating in a market size of approximately US$29.25 billion by 2029. The study provides an extensive analysis of ecommerce...

headline: Adobe Firefly Storyteq Tie Up Highlights AI Potential And Valuation Gap
summary: Adobe (NasdaqGS:ADBE) is integrating its Firefly generative AI into ITG's Storyteq platform to automate content workflows for enterprises. The tie up combines Adobe Firefly with ITG's Halo Intelligence to support smarter content recommendations for marketing and customer engagement. This move expands Adobe's enterprise AI footprint by embedding its tools directly into a third party content automation platform. For Adobe, this partnership sits in the middle of its core business in creative...
